children.text: This demonstrates nested list structures commonly found in documentation:

rects.text: This demonstrates nested list structures commonly found in documentation:

children.text: Mixed nesting should maintain proper indentation and spacing.

rects.text: Mixed nesting should maintain proper indentation and spacing.

children.text:
{
        "test_id": "list_002_nested_lists",
        "category": "list",
        "features": ["nested-lists", "mixed-list-types", "indentation-levels", "list-margins"],
        "description": "Nested lists with mixed unordered and ordered types, testing indentation",
        "markdown_equivalent": "### Nested Lists\n\n- Main item one\n  - Sub-item A\n  - Sub-item B\n- Main item two\n  1. Numbered sub-item 1\n  2. Numbered sub-item 2\n- Main item three",
        "complexity": "intermediate"
    }

metadata.description: Nested lists with mixed unordered and ordered types, testing indentation
metadata.markdown_equivalent:
### Nested Lists

- Main item one
  - Sub-item A
  - Sub-item B
- Main item two
  1. Numbered sub-item 1
  2. Numbered sub-item 2
- Main item three
